subject: Re: Suite setup not always run from Eclipse
msgSnippet: Thanks David, for now I ve gone with the custom runner approach.  I do think it would be a useful enhancement, so I ll send in an enhancment request as well.
messageBody:
Thanks David, for now I've gone with the custom runner approach. I do
think it would be a useful enhancement, so I'll send in an enhancment
request as well.

Frank

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Currently, I don't think there's a default way to do this. There's
> probably two steps to get there:
>
> 1) Create a feature enhancement request for JUnit to allow a test
> class to link back to the suite in whose context it must run.
>
> 2) Create a feature enhancement request for Eclipse to honor such a
link.
>
> In the meantime, I fear you're stuck with some sort of lazily set-up
> solution, with a @BeforeClass on the individual test class that runs
> the suite's BeforeClass code if it hasn't already been run.
>
> Or, a custom Runner that does the same...
